title: Amount of sleep and job performance

content.question: An observational study found that the amount of sleep an employee gets each night is associated with job performance. The correlation coefficient was found to be <math alttext="r equals 0.86" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.86</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. A reader of the study concluded that more sleep causes employees to perform better. Why is such a conclusion not correct?

choices.label: The correlation value should equal 1 for such a conclusion.
The correlation value should be negative for such a conclusion.
The sample was not representative of the population.
Causation cannot be determined from an observational study.
The correlation value implies that less than 75% of the variability in job performance can be explained by sleep.

content.answer: Causation cannot be determined from an observational study.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
